text: How do I use easy_install and buildout when pypi is down?
I am using buildout to automatically download and setup the many dependencies of my Plone installation.
buildout more or less uses easy_install to download and install a bunch of Python eggs.
This usually works, but it doesn't work if any of the dependencies cannot be downloaded or if I want buildout to find an internal package not appropriate for pypi.
How can I set up my own local version of pypi to automatically mirror the packages I need?
Will it still depend on third-party servers for packages that use pypi for their metadata but not their code?
